intro: Pomaria wootonii, commonly known as the Wooton's pomaria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring moist, sandy soils. Pomaria wootonii is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to brackish water environments.
